snippet: Interviews with employees and documents turned over to Congress reveal a midlevel engineer who tried to satisfy orders for a smoothly functioning switch that would help G.M. improve the image of its cut-rate small cars.
abstract: Raymond DeGiorgio, General Motors engineer who was blamed by company for approving deadly defect in millions of cars, has remained enigmatic figure at heart of recall scandal; interviews with current and former employees and examination of documents turned over to Congress reveal different account than one supplied by GM, and paint DeGiorgio as midlevel engineer who made numerous attempts to fix faulty part.
lead_paragraph: Interviews with employees and documents turned over to Congress reveal a midlevel engineer who tried to satisfy orders for a smoothly functioning switch that would help G.M. improve the image of its cut-rate small cars.

headline.main: A Fatally Flawed Switch, and a Burdened G.M. Engineer
headline.print_headline: A Fatally Flawed Switch, and a Burdened Engineer
